title.narrative: FLC: Promoting Opportunities for Women Empowerment and Rights in Tanzania (POWER) 2021-2023

description.narrative: What to be done and why? The proposed project is focusing on addressing ?Youth economic empowerment especially young women? who have been denied their rights to pursue with their education at teenage as school drop outs due pregnancies. Expulsion from sc hool denies girls (now young mother) their rights to re-enter into schools for education and skills development hence causing several challenges such as rejection by family and friends and hence pushing them into depression social isolation and limited acc ess to support they need to take good care of themselves and their babies after delivery. The main contribution of the project is to economically empower single mothers to improve their wellbeing and reduce poverty through increased incomes and other resou rces to provide for their children families and the community as a wholeDirect project results to be achieved by the projects Enhanced awareness and society that is more informed that support women rights and economic opportunities to create employment thr ough decent jobs and incomes to support them and their familiesSkilled and oriented single mothers in vocational business and life skills incl. human rights employed through own enterprises Improved access to assets (social physical and financial assets) a nd business doing behavior of single mothers to boost their income and economic status. Direct beneficiaries : 120 single mothers will be directly enrolled into the project and involved in various trainings and skills building sessions for the period rangi ng from 3 to six months. Lately; more than 600 youth will be in-directly reached through sexual and reproductive health human rights and life skills training to be facilitated by trained single mothers (project graduatesExpected outputs of the projects ?36 0 stakeholders are informed of the project and aware of the basic human rights issues and provide support to the project and single mothers ?120 single mothers identified and recruited into the project counselled and motivated to join the project and train ed ?Single mothers organized in groups formed 30 women led enterprises that are operational and growingTanzania 4H organization is the implementing partners; it will work with the local government authorities and selected NGOs working on the same theme an d areas.
